description: This stop is described only by Audsley, who provides the illustration reproduced here and says: �the tone of [the Krummhornregal] is said to have resembled that of the old Krummhorn�. Irwin mentions it only in passing with no description. The ancient instrument known as the krummhorn is a capped reed instrument whose tone is muffled and buzzy, not at all like the Krummhorn of the organ, whose tone resembles that of the clarinet.
examplesDescription: All known examples are given below.

examples.name: Krummhornregal 8', Brust; Augustana Lutheran Church, Sioux Falls, South Dakota, USA; Steiner 1977. (The stop is the only one on its manual.)
Krummhorn Regal 8', Brustwerk; Matthews Memorial Presbyterian Church, Albany, Texas, USA; Hofmann 1955/56. (Pipes by Flentrop.)
Krummhorn Regal 8', Brustpositiv; Canterbury University, Christchurch, New Zealand; Croft.
